pullrequest.title: Port SDF Filesystem to Ignition Common

content.raw: If ignition-common were more modularized (#14), I would propose removing the Filesystem code from sdformat and depending on ignition-common instead, but maybe someday
content.html: If ignition-common were more modularized (#14), I would propose removing the Filesystem code from sdformat and depending on ignition-common instead, but maybe someday

pullrequest.title: Port SDF Filesystem to Ignition Common

content.raw: In terms of the functions in Filesystem.cc, it seems to me like we should either a) implement them using the primitives from FilesystemBoost.cc, or b) replace the calls throughout the rest of the library with just the ones from FilesystemBoost.  The latter may not be possible because of backwards-compatibility concerns, but in that case, using FilesystemBoost.cc as primitives would allow this to work better on Windows.  It would also get rid of some duplicate code and duplicate #ifdef WIN32 sections in the code.
content.html: In terms of the functions in Filesystem.cc, it seems to me like we should either a) implement them using the primitives from FilesystemBoost.cc, or b) replace the calls throughout the rest of the library with just the ones from FilesystemBoost. The latter may not be possible because of backwards-compatibility concerns, but in that case, using FilesystemBoost.cc as primitives would allow this to work better on Windows. It would also get rid of some duplicate code and duplicate #ifdef WIN32 sections in the code.

pullrequest.title: Port SDF Filesystem to Ignition Common

content.raw: Good points. Do you see any code in `Filesystem.cc` that is probably broken on windows? The windows CI build isn't building at the moment :(
content.html: Good points. Do you see any code in Filesystem.cc that is probably broken on windows? The windows CI build isn't building at the moment :(

pullrequest.title: Port SDF Filesystem to Ignition Common

content.raw: The ones I'm most concerned with are `isDirectory()`, `removeDirectory()`, `absPath()`, `cwd()`, and `createDirectories()`.  Of those, the only potential bug I see is in `isDirectory()`; the problem there is "reparse points", which I don't know if windows handles properly (but which FilesystemBoost.cc does handle properly).  For the rest of them, I just think it would be better if we could keep all of the #ifdef-fery to a single file (i.e. FilesystemBoost.cc), rather than having is spread across two.
content.html: The ones I'm most concerned with are isDirectory(), removeDirectory(), absPath(), cwd(), and createDirectories(). Of those, the only potential bug I see is in isDirectory(); the problem there is "reparse points", which I don't know if windows handles properly (but which FilesystemBoost.cc does handle properly). For the rest of them, I just think it would be better if we could keep all of the #ifdef-fery to a single file (i.e. FilesystemBoost.cc), rather than having is spread across two.

pullrequest.title: Port SDF Filesystem to Ignition Common

content.raw: `exists` 192af04, `isDirectory` 1d3b18e, and `cwd` b28e9a3 implementations have been replaced with the ported boost code. `removeDirectory`, `absPath`, and `createDirectories` are unchanged because they didn't already exist in the ported boost code, and without a windows CI job I won't be sure any changes to them are working. I can create an issue to revisit them on windows.
content.html: exists 192af04, isDirectory 1d3b18e, and cwd b28e9a3 implementations have been replaced with the ported boost code. removeDirectory, absPath, and createDirectories are unchanged because they didn't already exist in the ported boost code, and without a windows CI job I won't be sure any changes to them are working. I can create an issue to revisit them on windows.

pullrequest.title: Port SDF Filesystem to Ignition Common

content.raw: The build had been broken for a while, and the reasons why the build is broken is beyond the scope of this pull request.
content.html: The build had been broken for a while, and the reasons why the build is broken is beyond the scope of this pull request.

pullrequest.title: Port SDF Filesystem to Ignition Common

content.raw:
Yeah true, but I think the while is not that long, see [this](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/30/) blue build still in the visible horizon. 

It had been fixed by pull request #33. I'll prepare a new pull request which does the same as that one and isolates some classes.

I think we should at least try to make sure new pull requests don't break the Windows build _even more_, because we're just accumulating things to fix in the future. This is especially important for common, because many other libraries depend on this one and this is blocking them building on Windows.
content.html:
Yeah true, but I think the while is not that long, see this blue build still in the visible horizon.

It had been fixed by pull request #33. I'll prepare a new pull request which does the same as that one and isolates some classes.

I think we should at least try to make sure new pull requests don't break the Windows build even more, because we're just accumulating things to fix in the future. This is especially important for common, because many other libraries depend on this one and this is blocking them building on Windows.

pullrequest.title: Port SDF Filesystem to Ignition Common

content.raw:
Those are fair points. The more we break windows, the more we have to fix.

However, we should not delay pull requests like this because of problems that are related, but not within scope.

It's better to move quickly on topics that directly affect our customers and other developers, than hold up development on a feature that doesn't work and has few users.
content.html:
Those are fair points. The more we break windows, the more we have to fix.

However, we should not delay pull requests like this because of problems that are related, but not within scope.

It's better to move quickly on topics that directly affect our customers and other developers, than hold up development on a feature that doesn't work and has few users.

content.raw: just noticed that according to the [man page](https://linux.die.net/man/2/rmdir), the directory must be empty for this to be successful otherwise we'll need to use the `ignition::common::removeAll` function instead. We might want to update the doxygen comment to reflect this and add tests for the `remove*` functions.
content.html: just noticed that according to the man page, the directory must be empty for this to be successful otherwise we'll need to use the ignition::common::removeAll function instead. We might want to update the doxygen comment to reflect this and add tests for the remove* functions.

content.raw:
Some of the functions have `IGNITION_COMMON_VISIBLE` before the return type and others have it after. cppcheck is complaining about those with it before the type:

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64/61/cppcheckResult/
content.html:
Some of the functions have IGNITION_COMMON_VISIBLE before the return type and others have it after. cppcheck is complaining about those with it before the type:
